page.title: 11 Mousehold Heath
page.content: Mousehold Heath used to be 22 miles in circumference and stretched as far as Wroxham and Ranworth.Since the times when the first Domesday book was written Mousehold was owned by the church. Mousehold was waste land for a long time but in the 1700's many people wanted to enclose the land. A lot of Mousehold was taken by rich people to have as their own. An act of Parliament was passed so that people could not own parts of Mousehold. A ruin of a chapel has been found on Mousehold. This was built on the site of the grave of a 12 year old boy. His name was William. His bones looked as though he was crucified. The people of that time blamed the Jews since he had been seen going into a Jewish house. He was probably murdered by a relative. He was later made a saint
